snippet: A poll of voters entering the Iowa Republican caucuses on Tuesday indicated a sharp divide between defeating President Obama and representing traditional conservative principles.
abstract: Poll of voters entering the Iowa Republican caucuses indicates sharp divide between those whose priority is to defeat Pres Obama and those seeking someone who represents traditional conservative principles and religious values; chart illustrates voting by different groups.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and MARJORIE CONNELLY

lead_paragraph: A poll of voters entering the Iowa Republican caucuses on Tuesday indicated a sharp divide between defeating President Obama and representing traditional conservative principles.

headline.seo: Candidates’ Electability and Principles Divide Iowa Voters
headline.main: Electability and Principles Split Iowa Votes, Poll Finds
headline.print_headline: Electability and Principles Split Iowa Votes, Poll Finds
